Body: After give a try of ThingsBoard RPC Call Sample
column9:
I found that "ROTATING SYSTEM" device can get message from v1/devices/me/rpc/request after it publish a message to v1/devices/me/telemetry by itself;

If Rule Chains transform messages from other device
column11: update metadata.deviceName and metadata.deviceType from others to "ROTATING SYSTEM"
column12:
"ROTATING SYSTEM" device cannot get any message.

RPC Call Sample mentioned that "WIND DIRECTION SENSOR" device send messages to ThingsBoard Server
column14: "ROTATING SYSTEM" device can get RPC messages; but according to my experiment
column16:
"ROTATING SYSTEM" only get trigged after it send messages by itself to ThingsBoard.

So
column18:
what is the best practice of Rule Chains on ThingsBoard Server to implement "deviceA trig deviceB"?

"

Body: I got the answer, if you want deviceA trig deviceB"
column9: you should create a relation between deviceA and deviceB
column10:
then add a rule node "change the originator" to change the originator from deviceA to deviceB.

"
